sources.title: Lily's Bar | Bars in Hollywood, Los Angeles
sources.content: Faux-retro styling and casual ambience once made this tiny Hollywood bar a favorite among locals, but Clark Street Bakery's Zack Hall has taken the old MiniBar to the next level with craft cocktails and a shiny new disco ball. Open since May, bartender Sean Stewart takes a page from his former haunt the Roger Room with showy cocktails like the Mandela Effect (vodka, Aperol and peach purée), plus a couple of hard-to-find absinthe-based drinks. With an under-the-radar vibe and minimal space, this bar is best categorized as a "show me" bar, in Hall's own words. "Ever been to Lily's? Gosh, I've got to show it to ya."

sources.title: Franklin Lounge - Review - Hollywood - Los Angeles
sources.content: Formerly Lily's Bar (which was formerly MiniBar), the tiny drinking hole maintains the look and feel of a membership-only airport lounge in the 1960s—there's a dark, wrap-around bar, a drinks menu filled with every classic cocktail in the book, and the ever-present possibility that you might go home with a pilot. OK, there are probably zero pilots at Franklin Lounge, but it's fun to dream. If you're looking for a sexy (but not too sexy) midweek drink date spot, keep Franklin Lounge in your back pocket.
